Thank you William, that sounds really cool. I will definitely try this way.=
 Normally I was using just some inputs, wait a maximum of 20 iterations to =
get a not changing output and I was done.

I never thought about using the =
outputs of the net to let it decide which inputs it wants to see.

Which ma=
ximum iteration count should I use with your method? Or do you set it very =
high and just look to get a very low difference in the outputs of current a=
nd last iteration (one calculation of the net, one step)?

But using one ou=
tput for choosing the ID of the input the net wants to see is to less for 3=
000 inputs, isn't it?

Otherwise I need to use 0.0006666 as the step size t=
o differentiate if it is input x or x+1 or x-1 the net wants to see. So -1 =
would be input 0, 0 would be input 1500 and +1 would be input 3000.

--- In=
 neat@yahoogroups.com, William Monti <william.monti@...> wrote:
>
> Yes, th=
at is exactly how I did it, but it was an idea I had, I was doing a
> histo=
rical series analysis and I wanted the network to be able to look at
> any =
past data, and not just pre-defined ones, so I don't have any document
> ab=
out that... But I can help you if you have doubts :)
> 
> The idea is to in=
clude in the genetic code information about the "sensors",
> a simple one c=
an contain just one variable (the input id it will read from),
> so when yo=
u are building the network, you read that data and create the
> sensors acc=
ordingly instead of creating every input neuron possible.
>
